Base:Descriptions.Base:Description: light blue leather book on Residents of Triskellion: Letter B
A light blue leather book on the residents of Triskellion whose names start with the letter 'B'. The border of the cover neatly displays an embossed trail of grapevines.
A light blue leather book on the residents of Triskellion whose names start with the letter 'B'.

A light blue leather book. On the upper portion of the cover is the title of 'Residents of Triskellion: Letter B' and printed smaller beneath it are the words 'edited and compiled by Xena'. The border of the cover neatly displays an embossed trail of grapevines.
light blue leather book cover

A light blue leather book. On the upper portion of the cover is the title of 'Residents of Triskellion: Letter B' and printed smaller beneath it are the words 'edited and compiled by Xena'. The border of the cover neatly displays an embossed trail of grapevines.

a desription of Babur

"Babur:
Babur is a spindly ample weasel, with long, delicate black fur, and butchered black hair. He has a goatee which is fuzzy, bug-shaped blue eyes, a blunt nose, and a dour mouth. A fairly unremarkable individual, I must say. I don't believe he holds any affiliations with guilds or houses, but rather spends all his time hunting the vermin of the city. He rarely seems to speak, his only word to me being that of his name after I first offered my own introduction. He left promptly after this brief exchange and has not spoken with me since, even when I query him about his health or day in passing. More information will be added as it is uncovered."
Update 8.10.890 - Babur is the same individual that I met so long ago. He does nothing but fish and wander about town, not even bothering to engage in social pleasantries.

a description of Basanti

"Bishop Basanti:
Bishop Basanti is a sleek raccoon, with short, lambent silver fur, and long jet black hair. She has round steel grey eyes, a short nose and a large mouth. One of the most renowned members of clergy, the Bishop is known for her kindness, understanding, and willingness to help. It seems she has been overshadowed as of late in the presence of Presbyter Ximen, at least publicly, but there are those that cling to her when she does wake, and who preach her teachings when the tenets seem to have been forgotten. It is rumored that Sir Matteo will be seeking permission to suit her, but I hardly understand how such an arrangement could be possible with her status in the church. More information will be shared as it is uncovered."
Update 8.10.09 - The Bishop left town shortly after my initial entry on her, as did Sir Matteo's desire to suit her. She has been spotted perhaps twice since, coming out to check on scrolls and deal with small matters pertaining to the Church. Elsewise, there is little to add.

a description of Sir Bayard

"Sir Bayard:
I have yet to meet with Sir Bayard personally, and so have no physical description to share. The majority of my information on this Knight of the Avoirdupois involves a Lady Calandre, and the well-known Sir Gregory. There was some sort of scandal in which Sir Gregory was courting the Lady and she left him for Sir Bayard, for reasons which can only be speculated upon. Sir Bayard and Sir Gregory afterward fought for control of the guard only to both leave the city for periods of time when neither turned up victorious. The public seems to consider Sir Bayard respectable, though the word 'hard-ass' has come up on a few occasions. It was noted by some that during a formal tournament he got angry about a ruling and simply walked out. More information will be shared as it is received."
Update 8.10.890 - Sir Bayard has recently returned to town and finally I have a general description. He is a huge rock-hard percheron with watery jet-black eyes, a short blue roan coat, and neat white hair. Many seemed elated to be in his presence, but to me, he lent an air of indifference to the atmosphere. I was arguing with one of his minions, Captain Brenner, when he passed through the lounge. He stopped, listened, and commented to the Captain how it was good to see him, but made no effort to interject on the dispute that was occurring. It was quite amusing to watch a Noble just passively stand there while his Captain and I exchanged verbal blows. And there is where he stood, silent, even after I took my leave. Now that he is a fixture again in the city I will see what else I can find out about him.

a description of Biggs

"Deputy Biggs:
Deputy Biggs is a lanky willowy hare, with wild, dense grey fur, and close-cropped golden blonde hair. He has bright brown eyes, an aquiline nose, and curved lips. A member of the Constabulary, he is most widely known for his peculiar accent and manner of speech. This informant noted he has a fondness for whips, and he seems to enjoy the hustle and bustle of his occupation, especially when things start getting out of hand. He has no known romantic interests. More information will be shared as it is uncovered."
Update 8.9.890 - Deputy Biggs left town shortly after my initial entry. I did manage to acquire a whip for him, for whatever good it lent him during his brief stay here. I did manage to uncover the reason for his lack of romantic interests though: he doesn't like to commit to any one person, male or female.

"Deputy Biggs:

a description of Braxton

"Young Master Braxton:
Young Master Braxton is a little muscular grizzly bear cub, with trimmed, fuzzy brown fur, and red hair. He has whiskers which are fuzzy, mismatched blue and green eyes, and a small, wet nose. Adopted son of Viscountess Kenina and Lord Twyrch, he is a member of House Bisclavret. He has been known from the start as a lover of combat, and seems to always be getting in trouble for attempting to defeat adults in spars. This informant has been warned to never feed him sugar. More information will be shared as it is uncovered."
Update 8.10.890 - Master Braxton has left town and returned to the lands of his parents for further tutelage. I had the experience of meeting him once or twice after my initial comments on him and can safely say they were accurate. His wild streak is not one that shall be forgotten, I'm certain.

a description of Brendon

"Brendon:
Brendon is a tall broad-shouldered boxer, with short, sleek white fur, and trimmed silver hair. He has a mustache and goatee which are wiry, sharp jade eyes, a wide nose and a firm mouth. A member of House Bisclavret, he currently holds the position of guard though people say he used to be the Quartermaster of the embassy. This informant has tried to speak with him on several occasions, but he never offers more than the casual 'hello' before disappearing through a nearby exit. He has no known romantic interests. More information will be shared as it is uncovered."

"Brendon:
Brendon is a tall broad-shouldered boxer, with short, sleek white fur, and trimmed silver hair. He has a mustache and goatee which are wiry, sharp jade eyes, a wide nose and a firm mouth. This informant has tried to speak with him on several occasions, but he never offers more than the casual 'hello' before disappearing through a nearby exit. He has no known romantic interests. More information will be shared as it is uncovered."
a description of Brenner

"Brenner:
Brenner is a titanic broad-shouldered mustang, with an overo, smooth chestnut coat, and long coal black hair. He has bright cerulean blue eyes, a sharp nose, and a firm mouth. A member of House Avoirdupois, he currently holds the position of guard, though aspires to lead the section himself in the future. He is attentive when present, but terrible at responding to scrolls or organizing events. This informant believes he has taken an interest in Miss Noe Raisa of House Avoirdupois, but has not been nosy enough to have the speculation confirmed or denied. More information will be added as it is uncovered."
Update 8.10.890 - Mister Brenner did indeed have an interest in miss Raisa and the two are currently courting, possibly engaged. After my departure from House Avoirdupois, I was fortunate enough to see the now-ranked Captain's harsher side. A member of Docktown came to me in fear saying that the Captain was loitering around the commons on a daily basis and that he had tried to pull rank on everyone wearing masks, chiding them for their behavior. I have come to the realization that the Avoirdupois are set in their ways, and understand why people might fear individuals walking about in masks, but did not understand the need for name-slinging that the Captain followingly engaged in with the local merchant. The individual who came to me said that to protect his honor he had challenged the Captain to a duel and the Captain declined saying the merchant was 'beneath him'. Commoners are commoners, even commoners in houses, so I was disappointed that the Captain was using his 'rank' to avoid a properly-given challenge. I went to the public boards and posted a note outlining what people can expect in Docktown and what they cannot expect. I intentionally omitted names to protect both the merchant who gave me the information, and Captain Brenner. The day afterward I was pulled into the seamstress shop where the Captain chided me for openly chastizing him. I assured him it was only my intention that people know how Docktown is and that he understand why what he did was inappropriate. I would have been more than willing to go directly to him if I thought he would be reasonable, and he proved at that moment that he is not. He simply dismissed me with the comment 'I can't wait until Lord Edmond marries Lady Theressa so I can watch your heart break. You were never good enough for him anyway.'
That might have struck a chord because for awhile I was bound and determined to hurt him for those words. I eventually spoke to Noelane and shared with her some information, but told her there would be no more from me if I didn't receive an apology from the Captain. No apology came. I had a chance meeting with Baroness Faye who apologized on his behalf, and while I appreciated it, I told her that it wasn't her place to make ammends for his harshness. A few days later, Captain Brenner was passing through the Newtown courier area and stopped. I was chatting with Fyros at the time and it seemed Brenner was interested in our conversation. After a few moments he began scanning the nearby buildings, as if he thought I had an assassin lurking somewhere to get rid of him. I amusedly assured him I had no desire to kill anybody and that even if I did, I wouldn't hurt him because he didn't hurt me physically. I told him I thought our feud was silly as we both acted as we believed was right, and that we needed to move on. He followingly commented that he has no idea why he ever trusts me, but ... and showed me a plan for a restaurant in the works. He said he wanted my advice on it, but I had to depart shortly afterward. I did ask him to scroll me with whatever aid he was requiring.

a description of Brooks

"Brooks:
Envoy Brooks is an elfin chiseled horse, with a trimmed, sleek coal black coat, and short coal black hair. He has bright emerald eyes, a fine nose, and a firm mouth. A gentry man of House Avoirdupois, he acts as a go-between in the Constabulary as an Envoy for Nobility. This informant has spent a fair amount of time in his presence, and finds him to be articulate and fairly intelligent. He has a love for fine clothing and fashion, and aspires to leadership but doesn't necessarily possess the drive or experience to be successful at it. He is quite charming in his subtle flirtatiousness, but dangerous in that he works to further the goals of his sister, miss Aeryn. I suspect he looks for a way to cement himself in the house also, but he has a reluctance to leave the Constabulary, so one has to wonder how he will do it. He has no known romantic interests, but spends a good amount of time with the slave Ryan who this informant will be questioning as she is able. More information will be added as it is uncovered."
Update 8.10.890 - Mister Brooks left town after my first entry. I had a small outing with him once in which he expressed some loose beliefs about having multiple partners in relationships and the natural instincts of men and women. I declined his company after this excursion.

a description of Brumble

"Brumble:
This informant has never met with said individual, and so has no physical description to share. Brumble is the Scudiero, or Squire, of House Rinaldi, and assistant to Lord Mercutio who oversees trade in the city. It is said he possesses much finery for purchase in a hidden warehouse, but the seamstresses cannot find it no matter how desperately they try. He has an adopted daughter, miss Una, who is a seamstress in the house. He has no known romantic interests. More information will be added as it is uncovered."
Update 8.10.890 - Sir Brumble is a large, compact porcupine with dense fawn quills, wiry whiskers, and round yellow eyes. He was not too long ago elevated to the rank of Knight by the Rinaldi. A vigil was held in the Newtown Cathedral for him to reflect upon his promotion before formally receiving it, and I'm told many were in attendance bearing tokens to support his focus. He still has no known romantic interests and I have still have yet to speak with him in person for more than a few moments.

a description of Bruno

"Bruno:
This informant has never met with said individual, and so has no physical description to share. He is the leading blacksmith in the city and has been here the longest to most everyone's knowledge. His wealth has been created through his own hard work, and his wisdom of weapons and their uses is said to be truly astounding. He has an adopted daughter, miss Rachelle, and is married to the Rinaldi stonemason, miss Shaer. More information will be added as it is uncovered."
Update 8.10.890 - Bruno is a tall husky snow leopard, with short, spotted fur, almond-shaped steel grey eyes, and neat black hair. He has a trimmed van-dyke. Bruno's daughter and wife appear to have left the city, as I haven't seen them in months upon months. He has no known romantic interests outside of his marriage, which says something about his character and his loyalty. I have gotten to know him on a more personal level, as he has aided me during my difficult times with Sir Matteo, and listened to my plans for the pardoning of Captain Seaweed Joe. He is a cautious individual, but more than willing ot help if he believes the cause is right and will benefit more than one person.

a description of Botond

"Botond:
"Botond is a tall athletic weasel, with short, matted chestnut fur, and long matted coffee brown hair. He has bloodshot green-dotted azure eyes and a dirty beard. This is an individual not known to many. He served as a swamp guide once in an expedition which Clover took part in, which is how I learned of him. He has made his home in a swamp clearing and from there imports moonshine through the Sailors Guild into the city. We are currently working with him to acquire some leeches for the healers to use. Key note: He's always more than happy to help if the price is right.

"Botond:
"Botond is a tall athletic weasel, with short, matted chestnut fur, and long matted coffee brown hair. He has bloodshot green-dotted azure eyes and a dirty beard. a description of Breeze

"Breeze:
"Breeze is a tiny toned fuzzy lop, with long, fuzzy strawberry blonde fur, and long cerise streaked pale blonde hair. She has large brown eyes and a tattoo of a butterfly on her right ear. She currently serves as a deputy in the Constabulary, though hasn't been seen for nearing a month. It is believed she has a romantic relationship with Doctor Jahren, but I have been unable to confirm thus far.

"Breeze:
"Breeze is a tiny toned fuzzy lop, with long, fuzzy strawberry blonde fur, and long cerise streaked pale blonde hair. She has large brown eyes and a tattoo of a butterfly on her right ear. She currently serves as a deputy in the Constabulary, though hasn't been seen for nearing a month. It is believed she has a romantic relationship with Doctor Jahren, but I have been unable to confirm thus far.
a description of Brie

"Brie:
"Brie is a slim delicate mink, with short, sleek black fur, narrow lavender eyes, and long flouncy rich vanilla hair. She is the primary dye mixer for the seamstressing guild Rainbow Rags and a lead seamstress. I don't know much about her aside from the fact her speech patterns seem to reflect those of her boss, Cincin. She's good about making deals with people and excels at mathematics; her bill outlines being more complicated than mine by far. She has no known romantic interests, but you'd never be able to tell as single people are rarely as happy as she makes herself out to be. There have been a few occasions where I simply left the area, unable to handle her exceedingly cheerful disposition. That said, her stitching rivals that of Mistress Meepers, and so one does have to choose which to do business with.

a description of Brutos

"Brutos:
"Brutos is a towering rock-hard bullmastiff, with short, scraggly dark brown fur, beady amaranth eyes, and shoulder-length wavy coal black hair. He has neatly-trimmed sideburns, and at least three tattoos. One on his left forearm, one on his right, and one on his chest of a bear claw. He is currently employed by Clover as a bodyguard. His pluralized speech does, at times, make him sound dim-witted, but he's actually quite intelligent, and certainly a formidable opponent in the arena. I courted him for a short time before deciding that we are just too different to be romantically involved, but he wears a locket of trust I gifted him around his neck still. He followingly courted Marea, not even observing the proper month's time of waiting between relationships. She cheated on him with a female, though I dont know precisely who, and they split it off. He is currently courting miss Hush who claims to be madly in love with. Regardless of his cluelessness in relationships he is a good person to have as an ally and someone that can be easily trusted.

"Brutos:
"Brutos is a towering rock-hard bullmastiff, with short, scraggly dark brown fur, beady amaranth eyes, and shoulder-length wavy coal black hair. the spine of the book
The spine of the book is made from light blue leather.
